Title: R.AI.N. - WE'RE ALL IN THI$ TOGETH£R
Thesis: It appears there is an overlooked financial aspect to the public health emergency that is the COVID-19 pandemic.
Conclusion:
- Developing countries have imposed lockdowns and then borrowed money en mass from the IMF and World Bank.
- Advanced countries have outlawed the real economy and replaced it with a Covid Economy.
- Media organizations, journalists get free money to present the daily case numbers.
- Hospitals and health care practitioners are on the frontline of receiving extra funding.
- Everyone and their dog is cashing out the never-ending cash that flows from the top down.
- Klaus Schwab of the World Economic Forum is keen on merging our digital, biological and physical identities, presumably via vaccines based on "synthetic biology".
- Perpetual lockdowns seem to have altered the world's economy in an irreversible way, en route to a Great Reset and Central Bank Digital Currencies.

Piece.Title: The world's poorer countries have requested funds right after they impose lockdowns.
Piece.Thesis:
The world's poorer countries have requested funds right after they impose lockdowns.
The World Bank is also loaning a hundred developing countries.
Some think these loans are a bad idea in the long run.
When a country owes money to international organizations, it risks losing it's sovereignty and natural resources.

When a country owes money to international organizations, it risks losing it's sovereignty. and, natural resources.

Piece.Title: Advanced economies and bankruptcy by design.
Piece.Thesis: If these loans are not paid back, it becomes national debt. This looks increasingly like bankruptcy by design. If a country becomes indebted they will eventually lose state assets like public utility companies, natural resources and ultimately sovereignty. Essentially all countries await the same fate as famously bankrupt Greece, Argentina etc.

References.Title: Where does bailout money come from and who will pay for it?
References.Description: In developed countries, such as UK and France, private companies are borrowing huge sums of money from banks. with State Loan Guarantees. How will they pay these back, with the perpetual lockdowns? If these loans are not paid back, it becomes national debt.

References.Title: UPDATED – COVID-19 | France: State Guarantee Scheme for New Money Loans
References.Description: This looks increasingly, like bankruptcy, by design. If a country becomes indebted, they will eventually lose state assets, like public utility companies, natural resources, and ultimately sovereignty. Could some of the strongest economies, be on the steps, of famously bankrupt, Greece and Argentina?

Piece.Title: Should news media investigate and question authority, or get free money to follow a narrative?

Is a journalist supposed to investigate and question authority or get free money to follow a narrative?
At the more local level, numerous funds have been setup throughout the world, that offer money to journalists to inform the public and help them "make safe decisions".

Klaus Schwab of the World Economic Forum:
".  people assume we are just going back to the good old world. This is fiction, it will not happen. "
". you will own nothing, and you will be happy. "
". research for vaccines using completely new methods based on synthetic biology. "
". fusion of our physical, digital and biological identity. "

Piece.Title: Companies / Businesses / Employers. How are they affected?
Piece.Thesis:
Employers are expected to carry out COVID-19 risk assessments and get  "Covid secure" certifications for businesses. They have to play along to stay in business and to participate in the furlough schemes. This might eventually lead to imposing vaccine mandates to their workforce.
A whole new covid economy has spun up, seemingly set to replace the normal economic activity that has been outlawed.
